J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> I like the general idea. I'd like to see the input and the expected
> output to be more obviously marked as such. Perhaps we could have one
> convenience version where instead of @Parameter(0) we have @Input and
> for @Parameter(1) we have @ExpectedResult. It's just a question of
> revealing intent.

I'm not sure about this just yet.  I like the idea, but since JUnit does 
not help you at all in ensuring that the second parameter is used as an 
expected result, I would fear that a specially-named annotation would 
promise more magic than could actually be delivered, and be confusing.

> (And now that I have Tiger, I can actually try it out!)

Let us know when you do!

    David Saff
